question: 与える
userExplanation: often implies giving to an inferior
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>give</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to give</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to grant</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You go <vocabulary>to give</vocabulary> a bone to your dog. <reading>Atta</reading> (<ja>あた</ja>) boy, Sparky! <reading>Atta</reading> boy.
